item.title: Are you missing anything? ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’»
item.description: I have created Brainstormer to make it easier for YOU to facilitate brainstorms. Â Maybe you tried it out, and something is not quite fitting with how you would like to brainstorm. Â Well, let’s just create the tool as you would like it! There are several ways to how you can be a part of that. Â Contributing Brainstormer is open for everyone to contribute to. If you want to take part, you can find the repository on GitHub.

item.title: BRAINSTORMER IS OPEN SOURCE! ğŸ‰
item.description: Brainstormer is all about ideas. And I am sure that everybody who uses Brainstormer has plenty of them. Â I want to invite everyone to join the development of this project. Â There are two ways for that to happen: Help plan what should be developed next, and develop it! Get the code and start remixing it to fit your own needs. You - are free to host your remixed project somewhere else as long as you also make your changes open source.

item.title: About Brainstormer
item.description: Hi ğŸ‘‹ Â I’m Lone, and I am the maker of this tool. Â I reside in Copenhagen, where I work with product management. In that role, I often facilitate different kinds of creative processes, which is something I really enjoy! Â During the covid-19 lockdown, when everything suddenly had to be online, I realized how much extra effort you have to put into remote facilitation, and I wanted to do something about it!

item.title: People are brainstorming around the world ğŸŒ
item.description: Reviews, video tutorials and articles about Brainstormer are popping up. Â It makes me very happy to see people having productive brainstorming session and appreciating Brainstormer’s ease of use all around the world! Â Video tutorials Just look at these video tutorials that facilitators from different parts of the world, all dedicated to sharing useful resources with their peers, have been producing. Â Â ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· - South Korea Â Unfortunately I don’t speak Korean, but luckily Youtube can translate automatically.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: Last updated Nov 6, 2021 Â Let us go through which data footprint you leave by using Brainstormer, and how your data is treated and stored! Â Your data When you use brainstormer your IP address is saved temporarily, but maximum 6 months. With your IP address youâ€™re letting me know from where in the world you are using Brainstormer, and learning the demographics of Brainstormerâ€™s users is the only reason I store your IP address temporarily.
